title: Does do what its intended to
text: I had to download this app, unwillingly, to verify signing in for a school email account, but have noticed in recent months, the app no longer serves any purpose, when prompted to type a number for verifying my identity, nothing happens, when asked about a pin to type in, same thing,, until they fix it, just verify your email with a phone number, which is annoying because many times my phone isn’t with me, and I have to choose between going to grab it or putting off the task at hand for later. Until they fix it, i’ll probably be uninstalling it.

title: Such A Hassle Now
text: First, I am a cyber security guy, so I get the change!  I hate having to open op the app to Authenticate.  I understand why it no longer allows you to authenticate from the lock screen with a tap, and I support the change.  It would be MUCH better it the app would push notify with the 6-digit authentication code.  This would prevent inadvertent authentications AND allow the user not to have to open their device.

title: Couldn’t be worse
text: This app will log you out and malfunction regularly. If you are using this for work accounts, be prepared to randomly not be able to do your job. The app will log you out and then ask you to use the app to verify yourself to log you back in, which obviously you can’t do if you’re logged out. There is apparently no other way of logging in either. And that’s when it even admits that you have a Microsoft account, which it occasionally won’t do. This has happened 3 times now. Updating and removing the app doesn’t help, I’ve tried. Sometimes it’ll make you endlessly authenticate something on a loop forever. Forget about being able to use it if you upgrade your phone. Everything is gone after that.  I’ve never seen an app work this poorly. Unfortunately, my company just adopted it as a log in process, so I’m trying to convince IT to find a way to remove it from my process, like the older employees have because it’s just too frustrating.

title: Garbage
text: Horrible garbage app that makes signing into anything a lot more annoying. Barely functional.

title: Terrible
text: This app makes no sense whatsoever. To ale changes to your account within the app, you’re prompted to use the app to authenticate your account - which you can’t do at all in the interface. Thanks to this app I’m regularly stuck outside my work accounts, unable to get in.

title: Worst application
text: Of the worst applications I've seen, the codes never arrive.

title: Don’t lose your phone if you want this app to work!
text: This app worked fine on my last phone until I dropped my phone in the bottom of a lake. I got a new phone with the same phone number, and now this app doesn’t even slightly work. I cannot get into my school email account and the help pages do not assist me in this issue at all. It takes me to a page where I have to type in a two digit number into this app.. which it simply doesn’t allow me to do. It’s a constant runaround and Outlook even takes me to the app so I can do the 2FA, but the Authenticator app is giving me a two digit number… to literally type into the Authenticator app… which I cannot do. It is quite literally one of the dumbest things I have ever seen. Anyway - hopefully no one else misplaces their phone & gets locked out of their work/school email the same way I have! There’s no legitimate reason they shouldn’t be able to send a code to my phone so I’m able to verify my identity.

title: Broken functionality
text: It automatically opens the Authenticator through Microsoft applications.  It then shows you a code and asks you to open the app to enter the code.  I can’t because the app is already open.  Please fix this Microsoft, seems like a very obvious oversight

title: User Error?
text: Normally this is fine, but having an issues getting it back on my phone after returning an upgrade which I deleted everything and factory reset it. I get signed in but then the app tells me to enter the code, but the app isn’t generating any code. I go to aka.ms/mfasetup on my work computer where I get the set message and have the same issue. When I was adding this to my upgraded phone, I was able to get a QR code once I navigated to that website on my work computer and was able to sign on that way but  today I’m not getting any other options. Idk what to, my help desk says it should be as simple as downloading it and adding my account again. I’ve removed the connected account, deleted the app, reinstalled the app and added my account again but keep getting stuck at the same screen with no code generating.

title: Please add folders or groupings
text: This is a great app and I’ve been using it for as long as I can remember. I’m at a point where I have too many Authenticator numbers I need to scroll through to get to the one I’m looking for. If we could have a way to set up folders or groups so it can just be two levels would be great. That way I can just touch the “work” group folder and get to my work stuff or “gaming” “personal” etc. Two taps is a lot quicker than going to the search bar and typing out the name of the one I want. Thanks.

title: Can’t login for months

This is so frustrating. I understand the need for security but this isn’t reliable enough.

title: Added Stress onto School
text:
Despite a multitude of students saying they don’t want this app for two-factor authentication, they went through with it anyway. 
I advise to BACK UP YOUR PHONE beforehand if you plan on getting a new one, if not, you’re completely out of luck and can’t authenticate yourself because the app is not smart enough to know they’re sending you a code to re-log into the app WHILE you’re already in the app, which is impossible. If you ask you send a code instead, it STILL says to go into the app while you’re in it. This app is an absolute added stress (like most Microsoft applications) and if you’re school forces you go use it, make sure if you’re getting a new phone to pay special attention to this one by making sure it’s backed up, if not, you’ll be unable to be access your outlook account and school accounts which you are paying for with your tuition.

title: Feel a little comfortable
text: I know that there will not be 100% fix or prevention from a data breach. Nevertheless I feel just a little bit comfortable knowing that Microsoft Authenticator will allow a safe guard some files I didn’t give permission to someone to access.

title: Stuck in an MFA Loop
text: How am I supposed to enter the code for authentication WHILE IN THE APP???

title: Useless
text: As soon as I add my Microsoft account, the app locks up absolutely useless

title: Hidden cost of use
text:
It is free, yet expensive, and that it tracks and drives information. Despite this Microsoft has without a doubt one of the most obtuse login workflows I have seen date. Utilizes complexity as a security feature at the cost of usability to the point that when one thing goes wrong, you are waiting 30 days to get back in to any account.

I can’t good conscience with so many other alternatives out there.

title: Fix it
text: Doesn’t make sense how I’m supposed to “open the app and insert the code” when I am ALREADY IN THE APP. Makes absolutely no sense.

title: Buggy
text: This app is not allowing me to put the verification code in once it tells me. It is causing me huge issues because it is connected with my work

title: Flawed
text: I’m honestly shocked that this has such an amazing review. It’s so difficult to get set up and after using it for a while it will only let you log in after getting it authenticated from the app (which for me is on my phone, so if I’m in class I still have to have my phone which is super frustrating). I also got logged out of the authenticator app on my phone and in order to get logged in I had to approve it from the app which is impossible when you’re not logged in. Extremely frustrating and inconvenient.

title: Sync issues
text:
The worst ever Authenticator app anybody can have. I have wasted 4 years of my life with this app, the only reason being, my organisation uses this Authenticator for securing my laptop. I thought “why not use the same app for all my personal accounts too” and ended up using this garbage. 

The account won’t sync to the iCloud if you buy a new device. You ll have to waste your precious time configuring the same. Backup is a joke. Needless to say no support for the Apple Watch too.  I have moved to authy and I loved it already.
